sJ6MNWK3Ztotp8KHhmCeoA.text: i randomly went to this restaurant for the first time last week after driving out of the city for a doctor's appointment.  i love thai food and haven't found many good ones in pittsburgh, so i figured i'd try it out.  i went for lunch... they have an extensive lunch menu, all entrees under $10.  I had the bangkok spicy vegetable curry- very good.  two days later, i went back again and ordered the spicy coconut soup... BEST noodle soup.  I can't wait to go back, even though I have to drive 30 minutes to get there.

E-Mw3n0tmtK1R5SWDpYsdw.text: After reading all the raving reviews about this place, I decided to order some take out to try it out. I went with the classic pad thai and Spicy Pad Phet Nuea (spicy lean ground beef with bell pepper, basil, and green beans). Both dishes which I am familiar with at most Thai restaurants. The Pad Phet Nuea was more for the boyfriend since its a bit more healthier compared to other dishes on the menu. Here is my take on it, and perhaps I hold a pretty high standard for Thai food.  The tofu in the classic pad thai are cut into small cubes that are fried. It was a bit dry and very chewy (as if its been sitting for a while). The flavor was a bit more plain then what I am compared to.   The Pad Phet Nuea was delicious. Normally there isnt green bean in it, but I was okay with that. They do put a little more sauce so I got to mix that with rice and loved it.  Otherwise, the plates are a bit pricey for Thai food in my opinion, most dishes are 11.50 to 13.50 with seafood items from 14 to 16 bucks. Good portions since I still have some leftover in the fridge for lunch tomorrow :) I MAY try to come back to this place to give it another chance, but i wasnt impressed. Also, if you need chopsticks and plastic ware for your take out, make sure you ask for it before you walk out the door!

8fX7nPLChqrkzmTdCtlibg.text: I tried different Thai food restaurants in the Pittsburgh area but this one is by far my favorite one. I love all things I've tried there. Every single dish is authentic.  Prices are reasonable and stuff is always courteous and mindful. Love it.

mQg9uxUw64Hyl6i2rLaVrw.text: Good Thai fast-food, but skimpy portions - at least at lunch.  For an extra three dollars, I only received four pieces of shrimp.  The noodles seemed heavy and soggy.  My food came out about three minutes after I ordered during a fairly busy lunch hour -- which makes me think that the pre-cooked noodles get covered in pre-made sauce and sent out the door.  Good for a quick fix of Thai food- not great.  Angkor in Greentree is still the best in the Burgh.

pSzQDky7wnx7_g8ZY8bw2A.text: As a first timer, I never had legitimate Thai food, but Green Mango sure help satisfice my appetite and experience with Thai food.  Likes: Their prices are very reasonable, a lot of variety for meat eaters or vegetarians, very homy atmosphere which is great for dining with a friend or company.  Dislikes: The vicinity was a bit too small and compact for my liking like you're seated close in proximity to the other diners, single servings are a bit too large, their hours are confusing, and the young hostess came across as unfriendly (even during my next few visits to the business).  Overall, the Green Mango has a great unfamiliar taste of Thai cuisine for those who are willing to explore new palates rather than having your typical oriental foods, which probably consists of Chinese takeout or sushi.

sgfnHdYs_GNLTMLHVHHQOg.text: Service was friendly but the food was bland. I like it spicy. Not the best Thai food I've had in the area.

m9H-SbTY1WJYA9eK3xlfag.text: Nice atmosphere, polite servers. Food was very good. I had the Spicy Shrimp Basil. Veggies were fresh. I didn't know you had numbers for how spicy you want the food. So I ended up with a number 7. Cleared my sinuses, lol. Great place. I will be returning asap.

QsfEKjw51ls9_0SyKjTJXg.text: This place is awesome! My boyfriend and I order out from here constantly and we've never had a bad meal. I get the sweet and sour chicken and my boyfriend gets the basil fried rice, delicious!

Zh0zbP4nuK3u7rMZZKJHPA.text: I tried to give this place a second (actually, third) chance but it just won't happen again. The employees weren't friendly but they weren't mean either. I felt like a burden to them. They were not busy but still acted like we were the least of their worries. The food came out quickly but did not have the Thai taste like other places.  This place is easy to get to which is why we go here but I think I'll go out of my way for better Thai in the future.

fQhh-9CsXOP3so_2C8-Bog.text: My husband and I decided to try this place while he was in Monroeville for work. The people were nice and friendly, but the food we got was not good at all. I got the Pad Se Eu he got the Drunken Noodles. They looked exactly the same and both were pretty gross. The flavor of mine actually wasn't too bad, but the noodles were like a gooey mess. It turns my stomach just thinking about the texture of the noodles. They were just waaay over cooked. We actually paid for our food then went and got something to eat somewhere else. I wanted it to be good so bad.

jyL9bvMe_ZLJS9fnvvxYvw.text: Decided to try this place out as it is the only Thai in the area. I really wanted to love it but it was just ok. The bubble tea was one big frozen mass. The summer rolls were good and probably the best part of the meal. Then we had beef drunken noodles which were ok but just seemed to be missing something. There is better Thai in the city but not in the area. I would probably give 3.5 stars if it was an option. But 4 stars aren't deserved.

-NeBfFKVhE8lan55kVwhCg.text: Quick review.  Not very friendly. I'd say thank you, and never receive  a reply. No smiles, nothing. Spring Rolls: Dry and tasteless. Chicken Curry (Red): Awesome! Nice heat and fantastic taste. Dessert: Sticky rice. Ok, I guess. Should have ordered a mango smoothie.  Decent price. Will go again for the curry.

sPSYzEHj8iEfpZygciXUYg.text: I've been here a few times now, and generally it's an A-OK place in my book.  Recently though had some spicy fried rice with veggies and chicken.  Very underwhelmed.  Especially since I'm pretty sure they just reheated my dish as one area of the rice was ice cold :(    Besides the mistake above, their drunken noodles are quite yummy and will keep me coming back.

06WAO_aXKDaRhf8mA51oEw.text: Really happy we got to try this place!    What we sampled:   Jasmine Tea (delicious and $2.00 for a personal pot! yum)  Tom Kha soup with shrimp (probably the best Tom Kha I have ever had.  This is my go to order that measures up all thai restaurants.  The shrimp were plentiful and the soup delicious!)  Spicy Noodle Hut Special with shrimp (Ok don't balk at the 10.50 price tag because seriously this could be a meal for one!  It was so good and the heat was just right)  Pad Thai with chicken (my fiance ordered it and couldn't finish it because of the soup, but that meant more for me :).  This was very good a nice flavor and a lot of chicken)  Red curry with shrimp (So good, I am actually having the left overs today)  There is not a lot of time that thai food will make me gush, but I loved this restaurant.  Service was prompt and the food was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red Curry with Shrimp
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai with Chicken

-7CpIGCmyxmRM8SkKrZ1Tw.text: I love the Green mango. I like this location just as much as the Regent Square location and since they are in a little shopping center it's easier to park and there's a Starbucks next door for a little after dinner latte or coffee.   Their Pineapple curry is the bomb and I can barely bring myself to order anything else because I love it so much. My wife loves their Pad Thai which is slightly sweet and nothing short of amazing. Their Spring Rolls are delicious as well as pretty much any of their appetizers, I have yet to have a bad one.    Its a great local Thai place with great consistant food and customer experience.

R5KRVJ8vQenFSnCXHPbjaA.text: My friend and I were seated in an awkward corner and waited on by two people who both seemed distracted if not completely disinterested in us.  Unfortunately the Thai spring rolls were fairly boring and I've had much better chicken satay with peanut sauce elsewhere. I was really surprised by the drunken noodles. It was as if someone spilled a whole bunch of red pepper flakes all over the dish. I knew it was supposed to be hot, but I didn't expect to be choking on the dish. I was constantly crunching down on red pepper flakes. I feel like the dish could have been reasonably tasty if I could have tasted anything other than fire.  Maybe I just didn't order the right things on the menu, but I probably won't be back to test that theory.

gz6QiYf18cK89kmQaK73-g.text: This place has really good thai food, and amazing bubble smoothies. My family loves going here because it just has a homey feel to it. The only reason im not giving it 5 stars is because there always seem to be flies buzzing around. I know it's likely something that just cant be helped (flies get into my house too no matter what i do), but i dont seem to experience this as consistently elsewhere. Otherwise, the staff are friendly, and like i said before, great food, and over all great experience.

5l79ahE4XsTRUJoHFaOfUQ.text: By far my favorite Thai place.  Dare I say, best summer rolls in PA?  Green curry is also delicious.  One word of advice, if you're traveling on business, they don't take AMEX, visa and MasterCard only.

tmPdbk-WiJgGAPAW4kGLVg.text: Freakin fantastic!! I always order to go and it's always there when I pick up. (And they never forget my silverware). :)

-6FIvEmanGvdf_HjWLJGCg.text: Nothing about this place disappoints! The food is excellent, fresh and I wish I could eat here more often. It is pretty far from where we live but we happened to be in the area and I'm really glad we were able to have dinner here. The service is quick and friendly.

Kr_vkWjmXFhhd4k7FR8aUQ.text: My husband and I had dinner here on Nov. 18.  This place used to be excellent but the last 2 to 3 visits has proved to be very bad.  We got basil fried rice and the rice was severly undercooked.  There were hard grains of rice in the dish.  The service has been steadily going downhill for some time.  Waitress can't be pleasant when addressing you.  No smiling with horrible attitudes.  If I went to work with these attitudes, I would not have my job very long.  A restaurant should be happy to serve you, not treat you as though the customer should feel privileged to be there.  WILL NOT BE RETURNING.  GAVE THEM MORE THAN A FAIR CHANCE TO REDEEM THEMSELVES AND THEY DID NOT!

0qHIUIHd4wfJXR1sLJ4xXA.text: I've been here multiple times. To name some of what I've tried: the peanut satay chicken appetizer, pineapple fried rice, green curry, pad thai and I'm sure others.  They have a lot on their menu, so I'd love to try some new things in the future.  I've tried a bite of some other dishes, and they have the potential to be very spicy!  So if you aren't a fan of spicy heat, be cautious.  It's always been very good!  I think my favorite is the pineapple fried rice - it has delicious flavor.  You want to eat all of it!  Plus, it comes in a pineapple...who wouldn't like that?  Service has always been pleasant.

C2FMEVKSmo3fcLANWE3m5w.text: Worst Thai food I've ever had. Spring rolls were good. Pad Prick chicken was inedible. Absolutely the worst thing I've had in a LONG time. It tasted like they poured salt all over it. Rather than being spicy, it was pure salt.  My friend had pad Thai with shrimp and it was the opposite- bland and didn't taste at all like pad Thai.  Would not return ever.

Cg0sBuwO5YWOLEKnosERrg.text: Took my gramma to lunch here the other day. Such acute place, with lovely staff. They have a fairly big vegetarian menu, which is great. They're pretty helpful at telling you if an option is vegan, but wish they would partner with Vegan Pittsburgh to help easily identify vegan options right on the menu though. PS, I talked to Vegan Pittsburgh, and they'd love to work with you and make you part of their 65+ vegan friendly recognized restaurants! ;) I got the ginger tofu, which was a great sized portion, not too big. We got the hot chrysanthemum tea too. Mmm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunch option: ginger tofu. Delicious! Vegan friendly!

yfjGok1Hp2wjggDzaCCnPA.text: Best drunken noodles and pad thai I found in a long long time!  I get lunch from there once a week!  The service for take out is super fast!  Prices are reasonable!  Highly recommend it!

i4JWN_-KvYgeyn_bo1TNWw.text: My husband and I recently enjoyed dinner at The Green Mango, but I was so tempted to return today as I drove by! We had previously frequented the Regent Square location but tried this location for the first time last weekend. It was a cold and rainy night, so I risked trying the unknown for the sake of easier parking. I was delighted to be greeted by an employee that I often see in Regent Square, so I immediately felt at home.  I absolutely love The Green Mango's Chicken Pad Thai and Phuket Pineapple Fried Rice. Both entrees are equally delicious, but I generally go for the Pad Thai since it's such a comfort food. I've tried Pad Thais at other restaurants in the city and in Florida (where I'm from), but The Green Mango's is by far my favorite.  Needless to say, it's a great restaurant, and I recommend trying any of their locations. We dine at The Green Mango about once/month, so I'm sure I'll be dining there again sometime soon!!

EBQRaKWKoBoYk9ljSZ3-8A.text: Green Mango Monroeville, in my opinion top notch Thai food. Don't expect an elegant atmosphere but everything is clean and functional. Love the Pad Thai and Lemongrass soup. We feel that the Monroeville and Wilkins areas are very lucky to have this restaurant in the area and would do well to try it out. The restaurant is easy to get to in the close vicinity of Sears and the Sprint store. Our many  experiences here have always been for lunch.  In summary, definitely very good Thai food and at a really great price.

y4eXT0GFXifFTMmjnjRYkw.text: Food not great. Very slow service... won't be returning here.

ged0fABnk6V6DI3Gv_Oywg.text: I live in Monroeville and The Green Mango is one of my favorite places in the area.   On my last visit (yesterday), we got the Lemongrass (Tom Yum) soup, Spicy Red Curry Chicken and Glass Noodle Salad.  All were amazing, especially on a cold winter day.   The server was also excellent - she recommended the Lemongrass soup WITHOUT the coconut milk for extra spice.  I am still a little bit under the weather and that stuff was like a healing potion that packed a good amount of spice and heat.  This place is highly recommended - very good to excellent Thai food for good price.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

x1xez-9PLb7A2HiUlnTVoA.text: Came here for lunch. I started with an amazing spicy Thai soup. It was so flavorful and just the perfect amount of spice. Great way to warm up. Next I ordered the pad thai. It was very good. I definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef salad.
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemongrass beef

vVpej359BtyfnJvOO_MSrA.text: The food is always good but the service like my rating is just OK.  Unfortunately, I like decent service even though the food is quite tasty.  Probably why I haven't been back in a year.  I'd rather have average food with great service than great food with poor service.  Who knows, can't say I'll never be back.  Maybe she had an off day and I know that happens.  Because the Thai Beef Salad is so good and their Larb salad just as I might be more inclined to stop in next time I'm in monroeville

c9JfBDL05kR3pKZJlrcH1g.text: Excellent Tom Yum soup and Drunken Noodles! Tried red curry here too it was the perfect amount of spice! Nice place to go out and eat if you're looking for Thai food. The wait staff is very attentive, always had a full glass of water for my spicy food :)

bipGyZa0dFAImMCv-_tulA.text: The laksa is addictive. I never tire of it. Unfortunately it's added 5 pounds to my scale, but it's so good, I'm good with the extra pounds Service is really good. They're attentive and kind.  Pad Thai, rolls... Actually everything I've eaten there has been good...but the laksa is the BEST

LDmNQsvBAlhmqsMU5TSoHg.text: I have ate here many times. I love their food and the staff is always nice. I love everything on the menu. You can't go wrong!!

rcXLS7YQ89L-vUoLOZ3yfQ.text: We went to green mango on a Saturday night. I believe they are one of the better Thai restaurants in the area. My husband and I always get duck and shrimp summer and spring rolls there. They always taste super fresh, delicious, and come with great dipping sauces. I personally am obsessed with the sauce that comes with the duck rolls, and request that even when I order something else. My husband got the Thai shrimp spaghetti which was very good. It was like the Thai version of an American spaghetti with marinara sauce, but with more robust flavors. I got some type of shrimp with vegetables that was also very fresh and we were serve both of our orders and hardly no time at all. They also offer the bubble teas which we tried once but I wasn't really a fan of them. The service is always good and the employees are pleasant. I will say that we do order takeout more than dine in and when we arrive to pick up our food we are never left waiting. I am glad there's a place in Monroeville that offers some variety to the normal choices.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp summer rolls with chili dipping sauce
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Spaghetti and shrimp
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp with vegetables

pCEE4MbCOy02dI-Cgkg7qA.text: The first time I ate the King Chicken - my daughter took hold of that dish & loves it. It is quite delicious. Today I ordered the chicken spring rolls and Ginger chicken. My goodness they were both new favs.  The atmosphere is welcoming, the service is good & the food Does NOT disappoint. The dishes are seasoned to make you have a flavorful experience.  Yummy!!!!

baEGbxCj3zkhHm12ARv7Hg.text: Definitely coming back and worth the wait for a table. Very busy and food was excellent! Mango smoothie was so delish. Had the papaya salad and chicken pad Thai. Wonderful little restaurant.

84hB1HP6OCxR0WJzsLke7g.text: I don't understand the great reviews. The food wasn't good & the neither was the price.  Fried spring rolls: They are tiny and very bland with filling that's non-existent. The sweet & sour sauce also had no flavor - it seemed watered down.  Tofu mango salad: I was excited for a fresh & flavorful salad, but this also tasted bland. I didn't taste lime or spice in the dressing. The tofu seemed crusty & old. I barely got halfway through it & had to throw the rest out, because it tasted "off".  Drunken noodles with chicken: This dish also lacked flavor & made my husband feel off as well.

dOEhHCxJM2jnv7_OFwUIog.text: I've been to this place twice. I had the beef satay which I thought was pretty decent. I also had the basil fried rice which was decent and the pineapple rice which was very good. My mom went with me and had the shrimp basil. The dish advertised eggplant which was scarce and had a price that was undercooked. The shrimp was bland. It basically was a fish that consisted mostly of green peppers and several overlooked shrimp scattered here and there. It had more green peppers than anything.  The atmosphere is pleasant. Not too bright or too drab. The biggest downfall outside of the basil shrimp is the wait staff. They aren't rude, but they seem disinterested in doing their job. It's hard to get a server to refill a drink, and they just seem like they'd rather be doing anything else.  I may come back again, but it'll likely not be my idea.

rP2h8AL6Tw0_dkHdxwvgqg.text: Some of the best Thai I've ever had...! It was interesting to see their menu have so many choices especially if you eat meat. They have a dish called Roast Duck Curry... order it even if you don't like duck. This was probably the most interesting dish on their menu. Their spring rolls were amazing and they give you four of them. Most Thai restaurants do two per order. Amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spring Rolls...
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast Duck Curry

EPYkI2l7AVhX_JYm2YmZvA.text: While we are usually Nicky's Thai fans when we are craving Thai food, I had heard that Green Mango was good and wanted to give it a try. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised with what I had!   For appetizers we had the Spring Rolls and Beef Somosa's. Spring Rolls were pretty good and I really liked the flavor of the Beef Somosa's. They had curry in them, along with peas and carrots, an interesting and flavorful combo.   For entrees we had Drunken Noodles, Beef Pad Thai and I had the Pineapple Curry...it was amazing. The curry had just the right amount of heat and the coconut milk broth was so delicious. I would highly recommend that and will definitely be back to get it! Both the Drunken Noodles and Beef Pad Thai were also very tasty.   While I still favor the atmosphere and overall experience of Nicky's more than The Green Mango, I will definitely be back when I am craving some Thai and want to stay local in the Monroeville area.

Kugq1ZkWa78dJ7j-LPqyjw.text: My husband works not too far from here, so it's a good place for us to meet for a quick lunch.   Let me just say I don't like curry. Or I thought I didn't like curry. Apparently, I like curry when it's well done. I REALLY like good curry. The first thing I had was the lak sa and I was sold. Delicious. I've tried several different dishes at Green Mango, and none of them have disappointed, but their lak sa is divine.   Wait staff is always polite and fast. The restaurant is clean. Highly recommended.

z-wcd5OhAjt-mLs9DydJQg.text: Really good! I was in town visiting relatives and was super surprised by how delicious the food was at green mango. The duck summer rolls were great, especially with their house sauce, the chicken in all the chicken dishes we had was super tender and flavorful.  Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant.  As a FYI, the restaurant is byob (which surprised us).

z2mTpkuIPpUHakyWG_KxpQ.text: Thai food, the best i have had stateside. Great service with friendly faces.

-oN-VWPtQU_zvWY7QqJiIw.text: We wanted to try this place for a while and finally had a chance to stop in for lunch with my wife. The service was a little slow but very friendly. We had two appetizers the Samosas and the spring rolls. Those were crispy and tasty. Unfortunately the Pad Thai was not up to our expectations. We've been to almost every Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh and this Pad Thai ranks near the bottom. Next time I would try the curry as I'm sure they have other entrees that are better.

kIr9UDY6L6fW4qcS0_glxQ.text: NYC Girl looking for authentic thai food in Pgh - stumbled across this place and loved it !  Curry, flat noodles , Tom yum soup = excellent ! Definitely what I expected !

CGU9FBkfgqQsYepWa5Hukw.text: Great Thai food. Ate twice. Authentic.

1tce2VbmuhZZr1k7C73H0A.text: We went to The Green Mango for the first time today. We were there for lunch and the menu seemed pretty extensive. We ordered the spring rolls and samosas and the tom yum soup. The appetizers were a little oily but tasted fine, nothing extraordinary. The soup was pretty good, especially on a cold winter. Me and my husband shared a vegetarian spicy basil fried rice and it was pretty good.  The one thing I wasn't impressed about was the service. We were seated at a two person table in the corner which was pretty cramped to begin with. Within 2 minutes of getting our soup and appetizers we got our fried rice. By the time we finished with our appetizers and moved on to the fried rice, it got cold. They should have waited till we were done with the first course to get the entree out. We also ordered some hot ginger tea. While the tea was very flavorful, the sugar was pre added and we usually don't take sugar with our tea.  Overall, the food was decent and so were the prices and portions. I would definitely go back hoping for a little better service.

6dDtnFypeVr1ZIxMyQHYXA.text: Nice, laid-back restaurant with good food in a basic strip mall.  It is sandwiched between a microbrewery and a Starbucks, but aren't the hidden gems always in strip malls?  Food was good and filling.  The waitress was attentive when she needed to be and unobtrusive otherwise.  We all had a hard time selecting from the fairly extensive menu but eventually decided on a chicken pad thai, a green curry with chicken, and a tofu dish with eggplant and bell peppers (it appears the menu on the website is a bit out-of-date).  Food arrived promptly.  Other reviews had mentioned that the tofu is made in house; whether it is or not, it was really good, crispy on the outside and light as air.  I didn't think there was quite enough eggplant, but I could eat eggplant all day every day so that isn't saying much.  Another review had mentioned that the fish sauce was overpowering in the pad thai, but aside from the first bite, it was reported that it was not noticeable.  The green curry also went over well, but the spring rolls were not the best I've ever had - the outside was a little too thick and the filling a little sparse.  Thai iced teas were pretty good.  My only gripe was that the appetizers seemed pricey.  I wondered how many they were meant to serve - a 6-piece order of samosas, for example, might be great for a group of friends out on the town, but for the suburban strip-mall atmosphere, it seems like it would make more sense to pare down the size and price accordingly, as the biggest group I saw at the restaurant was a family of four.  Overall, I enjoyed the restaurant and while I may not return to this specific location, I will probably check out the Regent's Square location.  If this location is closer to you, I would definitely recommend.

pZaBP1wMeSarcDGS2ldP0Q.text: Another user asked what the spice level of my dish was. The waitress never asked or told me. Based on my own scale of 1-10 I would have to say it was a 6 if you ate the sauce by itself, but only about a 4 mixed with the rice and meat.

VOgeMy7vS9XEGcttz8jVWw.text: Awsome Thai food and Thai tea. Most authentic Thai food I have had up here. Prices are very reasonable the restaurant is well kept and quiet they offer BYOB and no un quirking fee. I got the pad Thai reg and on a second occasion I got is spicy and yes they can turn up the heat no prob and still maintain the flavor!!!

3_yY946npAldn3uqgSVoUw.text: Great food and atmosphere.  I've only done lunch here and its quick and really good - can get in and out in 45 minutes for under 10 bucks a person.  Reccomend the classic pad thai.  Not overrun at lunch like many crazy lunch experiences.

jGvIbN3psllGWOxXJBli3w.text: We used to eat at the Green Mango in Regent Square (for years), and it was always great. Then it closed. Sometimes we get take-out from the current location in Monroeville, and it's been generally passable. Today, however, I got tofu & veggie Pad Thai and it was inedible, just plain gross. The tofu was spongy and tasted like it had gone bad, and some of the veggies were mushy and off-tasting. I called to speak to a manager and was told there was not one there, but I could call back later. I asked when a manager would be available, and was told they are in and out, no set schedule. I left a message and don't expect to hear back. A waste of $12, and my time. It's going to be a long, long time before I order from them again, which is a shame because it used to be so good.

1asEvsUsz0sLh2M3ebm3YQ.text: We used the Green Mango to cater a party we threw and we couldn't have been more pleased with the experience - or the food! Chef Ling personally cooked all the food herself and even threw in a few extras for free. She was collegial in working on a menu that fit our budget, and her staff kindly helped walk all the food to my car in the cold. Though our guests finished much of the food (including the persimmon sticky rice -- too bad for us!), what was left to us we found delicious, fresh, and flavorful.

TjobBPGqtC6pJSnMBrzWyA.text: We finally tried this spot last evening and were quite impressed.  I had the pumpkin curry which I liked lot, and my wife had the King Beef which is truly "fit for a king" (thus the name that Ling Robinson gave her sauce).  Portion sizes were a bit on the large size, but not too large (especially when you can take home a doggie bag and make a delicious lunch out of the King Beef)!  BYOB is a plus.  Ling spent quite a bit of time at our table talking and recommending things for us to try.  Service is a bit laid back, so I you're in a hurry, go elsewhere.  We shall return!

QK8n7JJ3TZFCV6MWJySRDA.text: I went to this place for the first time today due to all of the rave reviews and a serious craving for Thai food. I dinned on the Spicy Beef and Pumpkin Curry and it was amazing! I will have to say that the lunch portions are small and a male patron may need to add an appetizer to thoroughly satiate his appetite. I can't complain because the price was right ($7.50+tax). The ambiance was quaint, clean and cozy without the stuffiness that comes with packing in too many patrons in a confined space. The wait staff were courteous and attentive with genuine smiling faces. I will be back soon to try additional offerings on their expansive menu.

5r61_cEb5ma1E6UYKzwwnQ.text: Lemon grass beef stew with potatoes is amazing!!!

YjoQzJOBZdeS3NeCbDmD4g.text: Fun exotic Thai food that leaves you wanting more. This is a great restaurant to ease the pickey eater into Thai food. I would recommend the lemongrass soup.

59s5EuI-Q3zDQDzsHBQDIg.text: Don't get turned off by the ambiance.  This is a great family run Thai restaurant.  I love tofu and their's is freshly made.  Their Phad Thai is pretty good but not fantastic. If you're into Thai you should be more adventurous anyway.  Their Pineapple Curry is really good as is their Grilled Chicken with Basil.  If you're in the area, give this a try.  You won't be disappointed.

S0LoMyy9LUqWZ9PDWGYvig.text: I didn't think this restaurant was worth all the hype. The spring rolls many reviews talked about weren't that good at all. They were really small and were mostly dough with hardly any filling. Their salad with mango and chicken, however, was pretty good. My entree was the spicy drunken noodles with shrimp. The waiter didn't ask me for a spiciness level so I asked if I could have a four. Had I not specified, I don't know how spicy it would have been. But when I got my food, I couldn't eat it. It was WAY too spicy for me. I had to share my boyfriend's entree with him. He got the red curry, which was really good. Curiously, his was listed on the menu as "spicy", like my entree was. He did not specify a spiciness level and his was tolerable. I got mine boxed to go and luckily was able to mix it with enough scrambled eggs to make it edible the next day. I drove an hour to get to this resaurant and I would never drive that far for it again. Some side notes -  This was supposed to be a romantic dinner for our anniversary but this place has almost no atmosphere. No music playing and it's just echoed voices throughout the place. It's pretty small. Also, they don't serve alcohol but it is BYOB with no corking fee.

Zj1OtQFE2ub14_nP4OxTJA.text: This place had fantastic food - home made tofu and lovely stuff in general.  I had take-out the last 2 times I was there as I was in the area for work and had stuff to do back at my hotel room.

E-DppkCwL0Gv61u_203wRg.text: Great food and service. We have eaten her many times and the quality of food and service has been consistent.

WRDIuVSyjtzs2GTsJ1SjdQ.text: The Lemongrass Shrimp Soup ($4.95 small bowl) and the Thai Style Shrimp Fried Rice ($8.95) were very good. However, those lunch items were too pricey, for me.

FC0PVnw0pWsBU4OFFV9dLw.text: Worst Thai food I have ever had no taste at all. The food was very bland and did not taste like thai food that I ever had. I do not understand where the high rating came from because 1 star is not low enough for what this food taste like. Everyone at our table did not enjoy the food at all. I will never come back to this place again.

fzjATmaTnDWWRu95ztsjvA.text: I used to eat here all the time, stopped in, all my food was bland. They took it back, tried to fix it but only made it worse.   They insisted numerous times I take something home and despite saying no they kept insisting on a dish, and then CHARGED me for it.   I don't recommend going, and I won't be back.

we8DCrO-Ad0hz9Fb-FYpsg.text: One of my favorite Thai places in Pittsburgh! This family restaurant has a great thing going here. The panang curry with chicken or steak is amazing. The pineapple phucket fried rice is to die for and presentation is amazing: they serve it inside of a pineapple!!! The glass noodle dish is delicious the crumbled nuts on top pulls all of the flavors of the dish together. Don't even get me started on their bubble tea, freaking awesome!! Bottom line you can't go wrong here, anything you order from the menu will be amazing.

oStsOazk6wOJ2LM7uTlcog.text: The chicken pad Thai was delicious! The place is somewhat small. There weren't many people there, and it seemed like everyone was listening to the conversation my friend and I were having. But that wouldn't keep me from going back, and it certainly wouldn't keep me from recommending to others!!

8OXBkYAZv4cKe37Y_OcIlQ.text: We have dined at the GM twice in the past three years and wasn't impressed either time. As others have said the wait staff were not necessarily unfriendly, but rather disinterested and appeared to have other things on their mind despite our being the only diners in the restaurant.   We ordered three dishes, one satisfactory, one very bland and one that had an odd flavor, ... what I imagine floor cleaner to taste like.  At the end of the meal the third dish was cleared relatively untouched with no inquiry from the server, which I thought was odd.  Our intentions were to share everything so 2 of 3 wasn't a big deal.  In all it wasn't a negative experience, but not memorable either. Meh, sums it up nicely.

9xeyg2q2Unihckw3yeY9Lg.text: This Thai is very american and average, nothing here screams authentic.  The "spicy" was very low in heat level and had no taste, it just was bland. They refused to use spices and herbs that may have brought their food to a 4 star level, and just told me to add the siracha that was on the table.  I myself had the Magic Tofu, which was thin thin strips of tofu mixed with green peppers, some other veggies and served over rice.  My friends had everything ranging from curries to pad thai and their opinions were all very similar, there was no actual taste to the food, it was just bland.  Overall I will not go back, but it is the only Thai in the area.

q502SBhTeEmoV5vu1SiYsA.text: Needed a quick late lunch.  On Saturday they serve dinner portions only, So my husband and I divided the ginger chicken with chicken fried rice.  It was delicious.  Very  light and not greasy.  Portions too large even for 2 of us.  Reasonably priced.  We will be back.

YXy1eVuqcoiZv91juTn56w.text: I'm not sure how exactly to gives stars. My entire family ate here on New Year's Eve (12/31) around 5:00. We enjoyed fried tofu, spring rolls, and summer rolls for appetizers. Dinners ran the gambit from drunken noodles to tofu rad prik. Everything was good- not Pusadee's Garden, but good.   Exactly 36 hours later, my entire family (including my 11 month old son) came down with some rotavirus. It was a worship your bucket between your knees kind of day. For 3 days after, no one could eat anything. We are only just recovered. Now, I understand that we could have picked that virus up anywhere. But, our only commonality was The Green Mango. 5 adults and one 11 month old were very sick.   I'll go back. I just won't be back for a while...

Zwj45o1z9crG20IMRX60oQ.text: Although the wait for our food took a bit of time, the food was really good.  The house hot sauce (I believe that's what they called it) was extremely hot but amazing!

rOXDVFmf82U0gE11E_QHNg.text: I'm a fan of Thai food so my family and I decided to try this place. It's close to home and we reviewed the menu before our visit.   We ordered Spring rolls, Pad Thai and the Pataya Chicken Noodle soup.  The spring rolls came out fast and hot. Both the rolls and dipping sauce was bland. The only taste was of fried rice paper. We ate them anyway...  The pad Thai was average at best. One of my family members summed it up best: the food is decent, it's close to home, but if I had to choose I wouldn't pick this place.

dgqRhQe_N0SUuOZSpM_O2A.text: The only thing that was not enjoyable about our experience was the cold draft every time someone opened the door.  Other than that, everything was great.  We both ordered the Tom Ka soup.  It had excellent flavor with neither the spice or the coconut flavors being too intense.  There was A LOT of chicken in the soup.  I wish I would have ordered mine vegetarian because while I enjoy chicken, the amount was almost overpowering.    My fiance had the Pad Thai and I had a noodle salad.  The Pad Thai had good flavor, but was fairly average in terms of Pad Thai.  My noodle salad was tasty, but had way too much cilantro in it.  Overal, I enjoyed my meal and the experience, but I've had better Thai in Pittsburgh.

iK6TcT4q3i5HLfNbRNj3Lg.text: I went there for the first time during my lunch break. I ordered chicken with red curry to go. The young girl there was unfriendly, racist and disrespectful toward me. After I paid she puts my credit card on the counter and did not even say thanks or wish me a nice day. I did not feel welcome there and will not go back.

KH8Zq6xcRymTG900Rw5gsg.text: I really enjoyed this place!  I never had Thai food before.  The waitress was really patient with me & helped me find the perfect dinner. Can't wait to return! Also...it's BYOB with no corkage fee!!!

1cZD4kjFJAHRVnlYL4bFWA.text: My mom and I ate here for dinner today.  We don't usually eat Thai food, but we really enjoyed our dinner! The service was attentive and efficient, and our food was delicious. I ordered the spicy basil tofu and my mom ordered the rad na noodles. We also ordered the spring rolls. The flavor for all of it was great, but I especially loved my entree.  The basil tofu was definitely spicy, and I love heat! The portions were large and the prices were reasonable. Would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rad na noodles

cF_cx6ux8IH5phJFQz49dQ.text: Always try to drop in when nearby for the food. Recent experience today was an indifferent response to waiting 50 min for takeout (they told me 20m). Scolded for asking on order status. Tried to wait patiently as everyone else (10+) folks got their food first. Spoke to owner, but he did not care. Disappointed to say will not go there again. Not worth the disrespect and treatment.

v6KNT4lHrQlka-8el282DQ.text: I love this place! All the tofu dishes are delicious! The dinner portions are huge and the teas are something special. Plus, I've always experienced welcoming and kind service from employees. I visit often!

JajWq3VTsiWq6OM9P79aqw.text: The food is good. Presentation is good and taste is good. Waiters are nice and responsive. Prices are above average for a noodle place and portions were of average size. My hubby and I definitely didn't leave hungry but we also finished every single sliver of food off our plate! I like how Pittsburgh has a huge variety of Thai restaurants.

BlPhjo-FR78UuFXLT0FcSw.text: This place isn't too shabby for Thai food in the Monroeville area.  It's not fine dining or elegant by any means, but it does give you reasonable portions and is a good spot to stop for lunch.  While you won't be wowed by the food, you won't be disappointed, either.  They have some decent appetizers to try (like the Summer Rolls...try the duck) and the Pad Thai was easy to scarf down.  If you're in the area looking for a lunch stop and want some Thai food, this place is worth a try.

nCYE-7KafFTZc1g5jSOf3g.text: Had lunch here with some coworkers. Food was pretty good and the environment was very welcoming.

biWiT5Kt_TgI3Z7ATn8L7w.text: So this was my first time here. I ordered the vegetarian curry tofu and rice $8.50. There was a surcharge for brown rice $2.50. I guess everyone wants white rice. The curry sauce was so flavorful and rich  I really enjoyed it. The tofu was a bit slimy and chewy but I can't say that I'm a big tofu either so I'm not sure if that is the natural texture or not however, the atmosphere was nice and cool with the exception of the owner's daughter running around in the restaurant along with talking to the gentleman who l guess obviously is a a regular nonetheless I was alone so it wasn't as bothersome. Wouldn't say date spot but nice grab and go

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Food! I put sauce and veggies over rice very tasteful!

FcKqYC-POqgec6d4nXenjw.text: I used to eat here at least once a week but management did me dirty. They had a special barbecue family style cookout a few years ago. They advertised it on Facebook and said reservations are required, limited to 20 people. I made my reservation when the post was one hour old. A month later, the day of the event, they called and said my reservation was canceled because they had overbooked.  Shady. They lost a long-term customer, never ate there again.

1KISMottPE_H3vzELsRWVA.text: The best pad thai I have had. The chicken is fresh thinky sliced chicken and the balance of peanut and flavor is perfect.

x-hVxi61qUQAC1xjt0cRXg.text: Great food and friendly staff. Be aware that they've moved just around the corner from their former location. They are about 50 feet to the right, tucked back in the courtyard across from the Subway. The larger outdoor seating area is very nice.  We've eaten there several times and the food is consistently excellent.  I usually get the chicken red curry and lemon grass soup with coconut milk.  If you have less adventurous people in your party the fried rice is very good.

aerr-Z5rl00LKmsHUYRv1w.text: Still think I've had much better thai cuisine elsewhere, nearly everwhere.    Summer rolls (ones non-fried in rice paper) were as bland as bland could be and I'm not talking spices, just flavor.  How is that possible??? Even I make these.  Then I had pad thai with chicken. Chicken was overcooked. Meh. Would have been better without.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer rolls with shrimp
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic pad thai with chicken
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast duck curry

HC66NCM9Ily204cu6LV18A.text: Considering the lack of mom n pop restaurants in the area, the green mango is a decent place to satisfy your Thai food cravings. The place is moderately clean, ambience decent and service passable. I have tried their pad thai, fried rice, panang and green curries. The pad thai isn't in the top 5 pad thais I have had and the curries are high on chilles but low on overall flavor. That being said, I will probably come back when I can't make a hike to squirrel hill for Thai food.

Fw-pT_RoHrRgH1H3BEKpMg.text: My Thai samplings across the city brought me to Monroeville and the Green Mango. I had met the owners at the Taste of Pittsburgh event at the Marriott in Cranberry and had sampled some of their curry sauces. I was convinced I needed to go check it out myself! So I went for lunch to their nondescript storefront near the Sears store (great landmark, right?) and settled in for a good lunch. The atmosphere is bland but I knew that the spice levels of their curry sauces were not so I was anxious to give it a whirl.  The menu was extensive for lunch - perhaps even too much to look at and decisions become difficult when you only have so much time. I ordered and asked, as always, for it to be Thai hot. When my plate arrived my first reaction was one of disappointment. It just didn't look good and tasting it confirmed that it didn't measure up to other Thai places around. Don't get me wrong, it's not that it was bad, it just wasn't very flavorful and it surely wasn't Thai hot. In fact, it wasn't even a 5. The portion was a little small but the price was ok. Not that I won't go back but I won't drive across town to eat here. There are far better Thai places around.  On a positive note, they do sell their bottled curry sauces (both red and green) in the back of the restaurant and I highly recommend picking up a couple of each (green is hotter). They also have their own Thai hot sauce for sale but I'm not a huge fan even though I've been through two bottles!! HA!

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moo Dang. BBQ pork

vmpfuIQjuPzAjYys14lLVQ.text: Very tasty food and the price is also reasonable. Customer service is good also.   I will go there when I'm the neighborhood.

U8bAOMKlo12TOe5gdNKeMw.text: Solid Thai food for Pittsburgh. We ordered tom yom soup, fried fish cakes, pad thai, and queen tilapia. Our waitress made the soup sound small (she indicated a cup size with her hands) so we ordered one each, but they turned out to be bowls, so it was too much. I had never had the tilapia before and it was overly saucy, but tasty.  Not as spicy as I'd expected for Thai food which is good for someone who can't really handle spicy, but potentially disappointing for someone who can.

Hv-PbkeZvkYcErsDfY6hlw.text: It was average ... I'm a huge fan of Thai peanut sauce and there were only two options on the menu for that. I got Chicken Satay and Brown rice. My partner got pineapple fried rice with chicken and she enjoyed every bite of it. If I'm in the area I would stop back and try it again.   The service was OK not rushed and pretty quick.   The bathrooms weren't very clean either.

CtCHFJKqcPjfZpakHGfjew.text: Ordered the chicken pad thai, it was anything amazing just pretty good, the noodles were bit too soft, very filling however, good lunch spot for something quick. Might go back just to try the curries. ... more to come.

Bsjiufb5kYJgGgRItVz_cQ.text: Awesome food!!! We shared 4 lunch size dishes, between 2 people and we both took home a small doggie bag- chicken pad thai, drunken noodles, pa nang curry and basil fried rice. They were all delicious, but if I had to pick one, I would pick the pa nang! Clean spot and good service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken pad thai
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken drunken noodle
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken pa nang

V92733CZiGBJo5m5iiIjxA.text: Was in the area traveling for business and needed something quick and close to the hotel. So I open yelp and spot this place. Despite it being close to closing time they took my order with no attitude which was appreciated. I wouldn't say they were overly friendly but they were professional and got my to go order together quickly. On to the food...spring rolls/yellow curry/sticky rice/Thai tea. The spring rolls were yummy but I did not care for my yellow curry. There was a decent amount of shrimp but the curry itself seemed watery and kinda bland; definitely not what I am used to from Thai food. I ended up just picking out the shrimp and eating the rice. Thai tea and sticky rice were ok. I think there are probably better options in the area for Thai.

tTo9KnsVMEwssbhR8Rkcnw.text: I was a little disappointed.  The waitresses were really nice, but the lemongrass chicken was bland. It didn't have that comforting coconut flavoring that I adore about Thai food.  Then I got the sticky rice with "pumpkin custard" it wasn't that great.   I'm going to try this place again in the future. I hope it's just a bad day.

_NsQXJqchWoOQO3N8Pt4Xg.text: My husband and I tried this restaurant for the first time and we were impressed. The Pad Thai was delicious and the Beef Panang was also very good. However if you are are looking for spice make sure to ask for it HOT. I asked for spicy and it wasn't as hot as I'd hoped, but still very flavorful. The customer service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be back soon.

5haI_LHnPHgnMV-0w6kimw.text: Another lunch favorite of the Penn Center crowd.   The flavors of the Mango cannot be beat. The Mango Chicken Salad is just fantastic. The Thai iced tea is a real treat, too.  I have had several of the duck dishes and was not disappointed on any occasion. The red and green curry are quite good, as well.   The service is the wild card, but sometimes they are just that busy. . .

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Mango Salads + Iced Coffee

Ico74JR9HTGWlAYD8cXeKA.text: Well.... I've attempted to try this place twice now. The first time I looked them up and drove out there, just to find that they were closed even though their site and on yelp said they were open! Ok... no biggie! We'll try again. This time I called, asked what time they were open till. She responded with the times. We drove out there once again for the girl to tell us that they do not have a seating permit so it's take out only. I asked why she couldn't have told me that on the phone... I got a blank stare! I asked why doesn't any of your sites tell your consumers that!? Blank stare again!! I'll never waste my time again!!!

MsawhFeA_8ex--K0yqeRbQ.text: Can't go wrong here. I have been here many times,  with family and with friends.   We have never been disappointed with the food,  in terms of quality,  quantity or price.   Service is friendly and accommodating.    The Monroeville location is small and clean.  Ambiance is casual, but loud and noisy guests can be a nuisance.   BYOB.

TkwYAXGHZQup454jGd7_tg.text: This is your everyday average Thai restaurant that's around the corner. The food is good with an extensive menu and take out is fast and prompt. The in house dining is also good with friendly servers and fast service. I had the spring rolls which were crispy but tasted like the came from a frozen box. I also had curry and ginger tofu; the vegetable curry was spicy and the Ginger tofu was good thought I wish they hadn't over fried the tofu. Restaurant was clean and a byob

Kkp4v7fAaeoZ-u8nbcxE5w.text: Dinner for 4. This place was a little difficult to find but the food was well worth it. Mark, the staff was courteous, helpful and has a great sense of humor. The inside is small so we carried our dinner out. There is outside seating also available but it recently rained and all the furniture was wet.

RTrHmr1iqAzi243gKBZUBw.text: I came by for lunch with a party of 8. Most of us ordered the 'drunken noodles', since it was highly recommended. I'm not a fan of spice, so I went with the 'pad se eu'. It was delicious and the portion was large. I gave 3 stars because we were told that they were only serving dinner portions (and therefore charged dinner pricing) while it was still lunchtime. I found this to be odd and we weren't given a straight reasoning for this.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Se Eu

KL9uneasTWyUXP-ttAsoQQ.text: My wife and I came to Green Mango to enjoy a nice evening and sit outside in their nice courtyard. To my extreme disappointment, Green Mango moved across the street and no longer has outdoor seating. We ended up going somewhere else.

ZBk2fZJIFQLxJidocrK8vw.text: Well darn....I was craving Thai food and unfortunately this restaurant let us down.  The staff was very kind but the food was lacking.  Chicken was dry, lacking seasoning, minimal vegetables.   We felt like our dishes were a glob of dry noodles and a glob of dry rice without much added.  The prices are way to high for this quality of dish.  Bummer.

oeQnrn_-QHzMPRqXWrDPzQ.text: Do not recommend here if you are looking for authentic Thai food.  Horrible pricey lunch at Green Mango.  The $12.50 chicken Tom Yum soup is basically hot water diluted Soy Sauce, salt, and Sriracha Sauce without any broth or "Tom Yum" taste.   The $16.95 spicy Fish lemongrass stir fry basically is the same without the flavoring of lemongrass.  However, the fish pieces were well cooked and tasty when eaten without the very salty sauce.    If it weren't for the pity I felt for our server who confessed that she is not Thai, I would have gave it an one star.  She said apologetically that she doesn't know how Thai dishes should taste because she is not Thai.  I wonder if the chief is the same....  The restaurant located statistically in a blind spot where my T-Mobile cellular could not be connected. While searching for WiFi, noted there are two network named Green-mango.  I was then told no one working here know the password today.    I felt unfortunate and very disappointed...  Btw, the pictures of the menu posted by others here are too old.  Beware that the menu have changed and the price of the dishes have gone up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ordered dinner portion of Fish dish at $16.95, our lunch.  I was too upset and shocked with the Tom Yum soup, forgot to take any picture.

PNCoztgQBkmBeoxasspfxQ.text: A little pricey but it was worth it! I had the lunch portion of the Spicy Paradise Shrimp and for dessert I had the Sweet Sticky Rice With Coconut Milk. My waiter told me that on a heat scale of 1-10, he would consider this dish a 7. I found the heat to be perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Paradise Shrimp and Sweet Sticky Rice With Coconut Milk

22yCBEMlKtlefV0LmwnY1g.text: How about you guys pick up the phone for once? Always busy line or no answer.   Won't be going back anytime

RBqv3JcFigXDk0FmwrQdow.text: We really have been into Thai food the last few months so we have been making our rounds.  The Green Mango is closer to where we live so we went to check it out on a Friday evening.  Little did we know that they were in the middle of renovation and moving.  So they weren't in their normal location.  There were signs that said they were located now around on the side of the plaza now.  So we walked around and found it.  There was nobody in the storefront and a few workers in the back.  They came out to greet us and told us that they didn't have a license to allow for customers to eat here.  We had planned to eat here so we were kind of stuck.  We decided just to order take out and go find a brewery to eat our food at.  That actually worked out pretty good but it would have been nice to eat here.  I guess we will have to come back and see how it looks once they are moved and renovated.   As for the food my wife and I shared their Summer Rolls with shrimp and they were really good.  My wife ordered the Pad Se Eu with Shrimp and I got the same thing but with chicken.  I think their wide noodles ranked up there with the other restaurants in the Pittsburgh area.  7 out of 10  for the food.  The noodles were a little soggy but the chicken and spices were good.  We'll have to come back to see it renovated and I will be able to edit this review hopefully for the better.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tflzk4tsWHqw0uxyDHewzQ.text: I'm not a Thai food expert, but I love their food.  Most recently had the yellow curry and pad thai.  Both were very yummy.  Nice portions and just the right amount of heat at their normal setting.  Not too much, not too little, just right.  The place lacks of ambiance and personality even, therefore the four stars, but I will be a regular regardless.

4oCTmB4Gq5X9VztxhYZV4Q.text: The quality has gone down and the price has gone up. The prices online are not the same as they charge you in store. Quality doesn't match the price  point at Green Mango. Everything is greasy or poorly put together.

hxZX-h7KLV2ZmREhBenL8w.text: Great food, incredibly fast service. We had the spicy king chicken and pad se eu, both were so good.  Highly recommend!

bhN7hQvAebqNxoomGJ-vYA.text: I really, REALLY love Thai food.  My guilty pleasure is to enjoy a spicy bowl of fat Thai noodles!  It has to be so caloric but Lord when a place does them right it is so heavenly and worth the splurge.  For quite some time I have been wanting to try the Green Mango because we drive near it quite frequently.  So for anyone planning a trip to this establishment you need to know that currently they are only offering takeout.  Most people would want to call ahead to order so you don't have to stand uncomfortably in the small store front they are temporarily inhabiting waiting for your food.  Speaking of temporary structures, they are no longer next to Starbuck, and are eventually moving to another building in the same general vicinity.    Even though we were not prepared to get takeout we decided to just go for it and take it to a local brewery to eat.  We waited about 15-20 after ordering at the counter.  We both got the Pad Se Eu, mine with Shrimp.  I requested extra spicy.  We also ordered the summer rolls.  I thought the pricing was a bit high.  For both noodle dishes and the rolls it came to almost $40.00.    After the wait we got our to-go bag and headed out.  I requested some type of hot sauce, to which they only have sriracha.  A tad disappointed but they are under construction so I accepted and we were on our way.  So how about that food?  Well, I was happy and disappointed at the same time.  First I noted the portions were, in my opinion, small, most especially for the price.  The second thing that literally screamed in my face was, where is the spice?  I asked for extra spicy, this Thai was mild at best.  The flavor wasn't bad but it just lacked that kick that I look for and requested.  The rolls were actually not bad, say a tad bland without using the dipping sauce provided.  Overall it wasn't bad, it just wasn't real good.  I am hoping these issues can be all credited to the current operating system, IE takeout only, temporary location.  That being said I would like to give them another shot when they move into their new brick and mortar to see if there are improvements on quality and quantity.  Hopefully I will be able to have a higher star rating after factoring in some of these changes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jnbHwByEAwuuCwimwwovkQ.text: Okay here's my third update. I got Nicky's red curry and was completely blown out of the water. I forgot how good this dish can be. The green mango's red curry is watered down, bland, and skimps on veggies. This place used to be good but quality has gone way down.

3yORllgWGdLTHmmnML78DQ.text: I cannot say enough good things about the place.  The service is always amazing and the food is even better.  I've never had a bad meal. This visit I had the Pad Thai and hubby had spicy king tofu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy king tofu
Photo of The Green Mango - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KaUZoJcdQZCKMAlGsOC0ew.text: **update** I went back just a couple days later to get more of the yummy tom yum soup. This time I called to order and specified vege tom yum and chicken drunken noodles spice LOW. They gave me chicken tom yum . To be fair the broth was AMAZING, but the chicken was obtrusive and didn't seem to belong in the soup. The drunken noodles were not spicy and very good.   I went here for lunch with friends. Everyone enjoyed their food. I had the drunken noodles-chicken. It was really good! I also had tom yum soup. The soup looked and tasted delicious but after a couple bites the level of spice was too much for me to handle. I had to stop eating it. The waitress changed from a very competent person on the beginning to someone who was not that great. The not so great person took our orders and did not inquire about level of spice. She was slow to refill water as well. I will definitely go back to green mango but I will make sure to specify the level of spice!

oDGNy8DLRI4kjg0pGwP0pg.text: It was 2:45pm and my family and I were starving after a day of running errands. We saw the Green Mango sign as we were driving and chose to stop by for a late lunch.   The restaurant was empty. Bathroom was spacious and clean. Decorations were nostalgic of my Thailand trip days...  By the time we ordered it had JUST turned 3pm, which meant that now they charge Dinner prices instead of Lunch prices (look at the menu picture to see the differences in pricing)... That made us kinda annoyed knowing that if we had just ordered 5 min earlier - OR if the waitress had let us known earlier as we walked in or sat down - we would have gotten a better deal. Alas, it didn't really matter since the dinner portions are supposedly larger than the lunch portions and we were starving anyway.   Their Panang curry was on point! 5/5, very tasty, perfect level of spiciness. However, their shrimp summer roll was extremely disappointing, bland, dry and not worth $8.95... The classic pad thai was pretty good but VERY oily - much more greasy than your average pad thai. I wasn't a huge fan. Overall, I would come back when the craving for thai food hits, but probably only order curry.
